file_content.text: I just heard that Captain Dealk led his men against the survivors of your attack. He and his men were victorious.
You did it--you destroyed the Neutralizer! We've already tested our weapons. Everything's back to normal.
Now I can get my men back into battle. It's payback time, and the Empire isn't going to like our currency.
I won't lie. It was tough.
Wish I could join you.
Of course. I'm sure you must have much more important things to do.
My power is unmatched.
Just knowing that we've got someone like you on our side gives the men a boost.
You really did save the Republic's hide on this one. The shipment of new weapons was delayed.
If you hadn't destroyed that machine, the planet would belong to the Empire. Good work.
Have you dealt with the Neutralizer yet? You should hurry--before they ship it out to the front lines.
We were sitting ducks out there! A quarter of my men were killed and all because of defective weapons!
It wasn't defective weapons. It was an attack by the Empire. Command is sending new equipment to take care of the problem.
By the time new weapons get here, the Empire will own this planet.
Maybe it won't come to that.
Master Jedi--we have an emergency. Without the order's help, we may lose Balmorra.
You can count on me to assist the Republic.
How can I assist, Major?
The Force has brought us together. How can I assist you?
Tell me how I can help.
Captain. We've got a real situation here. If we don't get SpecForce on the job, Balmorra will belong to the Empire.
Always ready to assist, sir. How can I help?
Havoc Squad at your service.
Freelancer. How would you feel about saving Balmorra and earning a few credits at the same time?
How would I feel? Like a kid in a candy store. What can I do?
You're speaking my language.
You're just in time. I hope what they say about you is true, because I need your help to save Balmorra.
What can I do?
If I can help, I will.
What exactly do you need?
Of course. Although our intel is still a bit sketchy at this point.
Clean up your own mess.
You think I'm exaggerating? The lives of thousands of innocent civilians are at stake.
The Empire has a prototype weapon called the Neutralizer which puts out an energy field that disables all standard-issue Republic weaponry.
"Disables"? Half of our guns exploded.
I know that, Captain. I'm hoping you can sneak behind enemy lines and destroy the Neutralizer's generators--I don't have anyone else.
It doesn't sound like we have much time. I'll do whatever I can.
Consider it done.
The Empire knows the value of that thing, so you'll be up against automated defenses, Imperial troops and assault droids.
But on the plus side, your lightsabers won't be affected. Neither will your... other advantages.
But on the plus side, your weaponry is far too advanced to be affected by the Neutralizer.
Won't this Neutralizer disable my equipment as well?
Will my weapons work?
Notice I said "standard issue" equipment. Your luck is our luck.
Sure you don't want me to take down the whole Empire while I'm at it?
Sounds like a suicide run.
It'll be tough, I won' t deny it. You'll be up against Imperial troops, automated defenses and assault droids. But you're our only hope.
So--will you do it? The fate of the Republic war effort lies in your hands.
Let's get it done.
Yes, yes. I'll do it.
Excellent. With your advanced weaponry unaffected, you'll retain the element of surprise.
If you manage to pull this off, leave the cleanup to me. My men are hungry for revenge.
Sorry. I draw the line at taking on an entire Imperial army.
Too bad. [Refuse quest]
Then when Balmorra falls, I hope you'll take on your share of the blame.
Captain Dealk. I'm looking into it. And I'd appreciate it if you didn't take that tone with a superior officer.
